00082 /*
00083  *      BASIC DATA TYPES 
00084  */
00085 int
00086 C_is_space (int ch)
00087 {
00088   return ((ch == ' ') || (ch == C_NL) || (ch == C_HT) || (ch == C_VT)
00089           || (ch == C_CR) || (ch == C_FF));
00090 }
00091 int
00092 C_is_alpha (int ch)
00093 {
00094   return (((ch >= 'a') && (ch <= 'z')) || ((ch >= 'A') && (ch <= 'Z')));
00095 }
00096 int
00097 C_is_lower (int ch)
00098 {
00099   return ((ch >= 'a') && (ch <= 'z'));
00100 }
00101 int
00102 C_is_upper (int ch)
00103 {
00104   return ((ch >= 'A') && (ch <= 'Z'));
00105 }
00106 int
00107 C_is_digit (int ch)
00108 {
00109   return ((ch >= '0') && (ch <= '9'));
00110 }
00111 int
00112 C_is_alpha_numeric (int ch)
00113 {
00114   return (C_is_alpha (ch) || C_is_digit (ch));
00115 }
00116 int
00117 C_to_lower (int ch)
00118 {
00119   if (C_is_upper (ch))
00120     {
00121       return (ch - 'A' + 'a');
00122     }
00123   else
00124     {
00125       return ch;
00126     }
00127 }
00128 int
00129 C_to_upper (int ch)
00130 {
00131   if (C_is_lower (ch))
00132     {
00133       return (ch - 'a' + 'A');
00134     }
00135   else
00136     {
00137       return ch;
00138     }
00139 }
00140 int
00141 C_is_hex_digit (int ch)
00142 {
00143   return (((ch >= '0') && (ch <= '9')) ||
00144           ((ch >= 'a') && (ch <= 'f')) || ((ch >= 'A') && (ch <= 'F')));
00145 }
00146 int
00147 C_is_oct_digit (int ch)
00148 {
00149   return ((ch >= '0') && (ch <= '7'));
00150 }
00151 int
00152 C_is_control (int ch)           /* ASCII */
00153 {
00154   if (ch == 0x7F)
00155     return 1;                   /* DEL */
00156   return ((ch >= 0) && (ch <= 0x1F));   /* US */
00157 }
00158 int
00159 C_is_graph (int ch)             /* ASCII */
00160 {
00161   return ((ch >= 0x20) && (ch <= 0x7E));
00162 }
00163 /*
00164  *      INTEGER OPERATIONS
00165  */
00166 #define NUM_BITS        32
00167 static unsigned long p2[32] = {
00168   1,                            /* 2^0 */
00169   2,                            /* 2^1 */
00170   4,                            /* 2^2 */
00171   8,                            /* 2^3 */
00172   16,                           /* 2^4 */
00173   32,                           /* 2^5 */
00174   64,                           /* 2^6 */
00175   128,                          /* 2^7 */
00176   256,                          /* 2^8 */
00177   512,                          /* 2^9 */
00178   1024,                         /* 2^10 */
00179   2 * 1024,                     /* 2^11 */
00180   4 * 1024,                     /* 2^12 */
00181   8 * 1024,                     /* 2^13 */
00182   16 * 1024,                    /* 2^14 */
00183   32 * 1024,                    /* 2^15 */
00184   64 * 1024,                    /* 2^16 */
00185   128 * 1024,                   /* 2^17 */
00186   256 * 1024,                   /* 2^18 */
00187   512 * 1024,                   /* 2^19 */
00188   1024 * 1024,                  /* 2^20 */
00189   2 * 1024 * 1024,              /* 2^21 */
00190   4 * 1024 * 1024,              /* 2^22 */
00191   8 * 1024 * 1024,              /* 2^23 */
00192   16 * 1024 * 1024,             /* 2^24 */
00193   32 * 1024 * 1024,             /* 2^25 */
00194   64 * 1024 * 1024,             /* 2^26 */
00195   128 * 1024 * 1024,            /* 2^27 */
00196   256 * 1024 * 1024,            /* 2^28 */
00197   512 * 1024 * 1024,            /* 2^29 */
00198   1024 * 1024 * 1024,           /* 2^30 */
00199   2UL * 1024 * 1024 * 1024      /* 2^31 */
00200 };
00201 static unsigned long m2[33] = {
00202   0x00000000,
00203   0x00000001,
00204   0x00000003,
00205   0x00000007,
00206   0x0000000F,
00207   0x0000001F,
00208   0x0000003F,
00209   0x0000007F,
00210   0x000000FF,
00211   0x000001FF,
00212   0x000003FF,
00213   0x000007FF,
00214   0x00000FFF,
00215   0x00001FFF,
00216   0x00003FFF,
00217   0x00007FFF,
00218   0x0000FFFF,
00219   0x0001FFFF,
00220   0x0003FFFF,
00221   0x0007FFFF,
00222   0x000FFFFF,
00223   0x001FFFFF,
00224   0x003FFFFF,
00225   0x007FFFFF,
00226   0x00FFFFFF,
00227   0x01FFFFFF,
00228   0x03FFFFFF,
00229   0x07FFFFFF,
00230   0x0FFFFFFF,
00231   0x1FFFFFFF,
00232   0x3FFFFFFF,
00233   0x7FFFFFFF,
00234   0xFFFFFFFF,
00235 };

00237 /*
00238  *      if n is a power of 2, return log(n)
00239  *      else return log(n)+1
00240  */
00241 int
00242 C_log2 (C_Integer n)
00243 {
00244   int i;
00245   for (i = 0; i < NUM_BITS; i++)
00246     {
00247       if (n <= p2[i])
00248         return i;               /* p2[i] is enough to contain n */
00249     }
00250   return -1;                    /* too big */
00251 }
00252 int
00253 C_is_log2 (C_Integer n)
00254 {
00255   int i;
00256   for (i = 0; i < NUM_BITS; i++)
00257     {
00258       if (n == p2[i])
00259         return 1;
00260       if (n < p2[i])
00261         return 0;               /* not a power of 2 */
00262     }
00263   return 0;                     /* too big */
00264 }
00265 C_Integer C_pow2 (int n)
00266 {
00267   if ((n >= 0) && (n < NUM_BITS))
00268     return p2[n];
00269   return -1;                    /* too big or too small */
00270 }
00271 C_Integer C_mask (int n)
00272 {
00273   if ((n >= 0) && (n < NUM_BITS))
00274     return m2[n];
00275   return 0;                     /* too big or too small */
00276 }

00335 C_String C_strstr (C_String str1, C_String str2)
00336 {
00337   int i, len, max;
00338   len = strlen (str2);
00339   max = strlen (str1);
00340   if (max < len)
00341     return C_NIL;
00342   for (i = 0; i <= (max - len); i++)
00343     {
00344       if (!strncmp (str1 + i, str2, len))
00345         return (str1 + i);
00346     }
00347   return C_NIL;
00348 }
00349 C_String C_strrstr (C_String str1, C_String str2)
00350 {
00351   int i, len, max;
00352   len = strlen (str2);
00353   max = strlen (str1);
00354   if (max < len)
00355     return C_NIL;
00356   for (i = (max - len); i >= 0; i--)
00357     {
00358       if (!strncmp (str1 + i, str2, len))
00359         return (str1 + i);
00360     }
00361   return C_NIL;
00362 }
00363 C_String C_strsave (C_String str)
00364 {
00365   C_String new_str;
00366 #if SUN
00367   new_str = strdup (str);
00368   C_assert (new_str != 0, "C_strsave failed: out of memory space");
00369 #else
00370   new_str = (C_String) C_malloc (sizeof (char) * (strlen (str) + 1));
00371   C_assert (new_str != 0, "C_strsave failed: out of memory space");
00372   strcpy (new_str, str);
00373 #endif
00374   return new_str;
00375 }
00376 /* convert the parser T_char_lit representation (string) to scalar value. */
00377 /* the character string contains 'X' around the character X.
00378  * in this function, we simply assume ' exist and really do no
00379  * checking on whther or not ' really is present.
00380  * ## trigraph style is currently missing. ##
00381  */
00382 int
00383 C_str2char (C_String str)
00384 {
00385   int n;
00386   /* str = "'ch'" */
00387   /* type 1 : simple format */
00388   if (str[1] != '\\')           /* \ */
00389     return str[1];
00390 /* type 2 : \ooo (octal) *//* octal */
00391   if ((str[2] >= '0') && (str[2] <= '7'))
00392     {
00393       if ((str[2] == '0') && (str[3] == '\''))
00394         return C_NU;
00395       sscanf (str + 2, "%o", &n);
00396       return n;
00397     }
00398 /* type 3 : \xhh (hex) *//* hexdecimal */
00399   /* BCC - bug fix for a['\x'] - 4/14/96 */
00400   if ((str[2] == 'x' || str[2] == 'X') && str[3] != '\'')
00401     {
00402       sscanf (str + 3, "%x", &n);
00403       return n;
00404     }
00405   /* type 4 : \control */
00406   switch (str[2])
00407     {                           /* control character */
00408     case 'n':
00409       return C_NL;
00410     case 't':
00411       return C_HT;
00412     case 'v':
00413       return C_VT;
00414     case 'b':
00415       return C_BS;
00416     case 'r':
00417       return C_CR;
00418     case 'f':
00419       return C_FF;
00420     case 'a':
00421       return C_ALERT;
00422     default:
00423       return (str[2]);
00424     }
00425 
00426 }
00427 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00428 /* We will implement a binary tree string management. */
00429 typedef struct _Str
00430 {
00431   C_String name;
00432   C_Pointer ptr;
00433   struct _Str *left;
00434   struct _Str *right;
00435 }
00436 _Str, *Str;
00437 static Str str_root = 0;
00438 
00439 /* String Save Function. */
00440 C_String C_savestr (C_String str)
00441 {
00442   C_String new_str = (C_String) C_malloc2 (C_strlen (str) + 1);
00443   C_strcpy (new_str, str);
00444   return (new_str);
00445 }
00446 /*      Find a string.  */
00447 static Str
00448 FindS (Str T, C_String str)
00449 {
00450   int diff;
00451   if (T == 0)
00452     return 0;
00453   if (str == 0)
00454     return 0;
00455   diff = C_strcmp (str, T->name);
00456   if (diff == 0)
00457     return (T);                 /* find a match */
00458   if (diff > 0)
00459     return (FindS (T->left, str));      /* search left */
00460   else
00461     return (FindS (T->right, str));     /* search right */
00462 }
00463 /*      Add a string.   */
00464 static Str
00465 AddS (Str T, C_String str)
00466 {
00467   int diff;
00468   Str new_str;
00469   if (str == 0)
00470     return 0;
00471   if (T == 0)
00472     {                           /* add new string */
00473       new_str = (Str) C_malloc2 (sizeof (_Str));
00474       new_str->name = C_savestr (str);
00475       new_str->ptr = 0;
00476       new_str->left = new_str->right = 0;
00477       return (new_str);
00478     }
00479   diff = C_strcmp (str, T->name);
00480   if (diff == 0)
00481     return (T);                 /* already exist */
00482   if (diff > 0)
00483     {
00484       T->left = AddS (T->left, str);    /* add to left */
00485       return (T);
00486     }
00487   else
00488     {
00489       T->right = AddS (T->right, str);  /* add to right */
00490       return (T);
00491     }
00492 }
00493 
00494 static int string_count, string_length;
00495 
00496 /*      Find and Add a string.   */
00497 static Str
00498 FindAndAddS (Str T, C_String str, Str * node)
00499 {
00500   int diff;
00501   Str new_str;
00502 
00503   if (T == 0)
00504     {                           /* add new string */
00505       string_count++;
00506       string_length += strlen (str) + 1;
00507       new_str = (Str) C_malloc2 (sizeof (_Str));
00508       *node = new_str;
00509       new_str->name = C_savestr (str);
00510       new_str->ptr = 0;
00511       new_str->left = new_str->right = 0;
00512       return (new_str);
00513     }
00514   diff = C_strcmp (str, T->name);
00515   if (diff == 0)
00516     {
00517       *node = T;
00518       return (T);               /* already exist */
00519     }
00520   if (diff > 0)
00521     {
00522       T->left = FindAndAddS (T->left, str, node);       /* add to left */
00523       return (T);
00524     }
00525   else
00526     {
00527       T->right = FindAndAddS (T->right, str, node);     /* add to right */
00528       return (T);
00529     }
00530 }
00531 
00532 /* In the old implementation, the tree needs to be searched 3 times to
00533  * insert a new string.
00534  */
00535 #if 0
00536 /*      This function maintains all define-once-only names.
00537  *      It maintains a table of a list of unique names used
00538  *      by the entire program. This will save some space.
00539  */
00540 C_String C_findstr (C_String str)
00541 {
00542   Str ptr;
00543   if ((str == 0) || (str[0] == '\0'))
00544     {
00545       C_assert (0, "C_findstr(str): str cannot be a null string");
00546     }
00547   ptr = FindS (str_root, str);
00548   if (ptr == 0)
00549     {
00550       str_root = AddS (str_root, str);
00551       ptr = FindS (str_root, str);
00552     }
00553   return (ptr->name);
00554 }
00555 #endif
00556 
00557 C_String C_findstr (C_String str)
00558 {
00559   Str ptr;
00560 
00561   if ((str == 0) || (str[0] == '\0'))
00562     {
00563       C_assert (0, "C_findstr(str): str cannot be a null string");
00564     }
00565   str_root = FindAndAddS (str_root, str, &ptr);
00566   return (ptr->name);
00567 }
00568 
00569 C_Pointer C_addptr (C_String str, C_Pointer ptr)
00570 {
00571   Str p;
00572   if ((str == 0) || (str[0] == '\0'))
00573     {
00574       C_assert (0, "C_addptr(str): str cannot be a null string");
00575     }
00576   p = FindS (str_root, str);
00577   if (p == 0)
00578     {
00579       str_root = AddS (str_root, str);
00580       p = FindS (str_root, str);
00581     }
00582   p->ptr = ptr;
00583   return (p->ptr);
00584 }
00585 C_Pointer C_findptr (C_String str)
00586 {
00587   Str ptr;
00588   if ((str == 0) || (str[0] == '\0'))
00589     {
00590       C_assert (0, "C_findptr(str): str cannot be a null string");
00591     }
00592   ptr = FindS (str_root, str);
00593   if (ptr == 0)
00594     return 0;
00595   return (ptr->ptr);
00596 }
00597 static void
00598 VisitS (Str T, int (*fn) (C_String name, C_Pointer ptr))
00599 {
00600   if (T == 0)
00601     return;
00602   VisitS (T->left, fn);
00603   VisitS (T->right, fn);
00604   if (fn == 0)
00605     return;
00606   (*fn) (T->name, T->ptr);
00607 }
00608 void
00609 C_for_all_ptr (int (*fn) (C_String name, C_Pointer ptr))
00610 {
00611   VisitS (str_root, fn);
00612 }

00614 /*
00615  *      NUMBER CONVERSION OPERATIONS
00616  */
00617 C_Float C_string_to_float (C_String str)
00618 {
00619   return ((C_Float) atof (str));
00620 }
00621 C_String C_float_to_string (C_Float value, C_String line)
00622 {
00623   sprintf (line, "%e", (double) value);
00624   return line;
00625 }
00626 C_Double C_string_to_double (C_String str)
00627 {
00628   return ((C_Double) atof (str));
00629 }
00630 C_String C_double_to_string (C_Double value, C_String line)
00631 {
00632   sprintf (line, "%e", (double) value);
00633   return line;
00634 }
00635 C_Integer C_string_to_char (C_String str)       /* ANSI C standard */
00636 {
00637   int ch1, ch2;
00638   ch1 = str[0];
00639   if (C_is_alpha_numeric (ch1))
00640     {
00641       return ch1;
00642     }
00643   else if (ch1 == C_BACKSLASH)
00644     {
00645       ch2 = str[1];
00646       switch (ch2)
00647         {
00648         case 'n':
00649           return C_NL;
00650         case 't':
00651           return C_HT;
00652         case 'v':
00653           return C_VT;
00654         case 'b':
00655           return C_BS;
00656         case 'r':
00657           return C_CR;
00658         case 'f':
00659           return C_FF;
00660         case 'a':
00661           return C_ALERT;
00662         default:
00663           if (ch2 == 'x')
00664             {
00665               return C_string_to_hex (str + 2);
00666             }
00667           else if (C_is_oct_digit (ch2))
00668             {
00669               return C_string_to_oct (str + 1);
00670             }
00671           else
00672             {
00673               return ch2;
00674             }
00675         }
00676     }
00677   else if (ch1 == C_QUESTION)
00678     {
00679       ch2 = str[1];
00680       if (ch2 == C_QUESTION)
00681         {
00682           switch (str[2])
00683             {
00684             case '=':
00685               return '#';
00686             case '/':
00687               return '\\';
00688             case '\'':
00689               return '^';
00690             case '(':
00691               return '[';
00692             case ')':
00693               return ']';
00694             case '!':
00695               return '|';
00696             case '<':
00697               return '{';
00698             case '>':
00699               return '}';
00700             case '-':
00701               return '~';
00702             default:
00703               return '?';
00704             }
00705         }
00706       else
00707         {
00708           return C_QUESTION;
00709         }
00710     }
00711   else
00712     {
00713       return ch1;
00714     }
00715 }
00716 C_String C_char_to_string (int value, C_String line)
00717 {
00718   if (C_is_control (value))
00719     {                           /* control characters */
00720       line[0] = C_S_QUOTE;
00721       line[1] = '\\';
00722       line[3] = C_S_QUOTE;
00723       line[4] = '\0';
00724       switch (value)
00725         {
00726         case C_NL:
00727           line[2] = 'n';
00728           break;
00729         case C_HT:
00730           line[2] = 't';
00731           break;
00732         case C_VT:
00733           line[2] = 'v';
00734           break;
00735         case C_BS:
00736           line[2] = 'b';
00737           break;
00738         case C_CR:
00739           line[2] = 'r';
00740           break;
00741         case C_FF:
00742           line[2] = 'f';
00743           break;
00744         case C_ALERT:
00745           line[2] = 'a';
00746           break;
00747         default:                /* unknown control character */
00748           sprintf (line, "'\\%o'", value);
00749         }
00750     }
00751   else if (C_is_graph (value))
00752     {                           /* printing characters */
00753       line[0] = C_S_QUOTE;
00754       line[1] = value;
00755       line[2] = C_S_QUOTE;
00756       line[3] = '\0';
00757     }
00758   else
00759     {
00760       sprintf (line, "'\\%o'", value);
00761     }
00762   return line;
00763 }
00764 C_Integer C_string_to_integer (C_String str)
00765 {
00766   C_Integer imax;
00767   sscanf (str, ITintmaxformat, &imax);
00768   return (imax);
00769 }
00770 C_String C_integer_to_string (C_Integer value, C_String line)
00771 {
00772   sprintf (line, ITintmaxformat, value);
00773   return line;
00774 }
00775 C_Integer C_string_to_hex (C_String str)
00776 {
00777   C_Integer value;
00778   sscanf (str, ITintmaxhexfmt, &value);
00779   return value;
00780 }
00781 C_String C_hex_to_string (C_Integer value, C_String line)
00782 {
00783   sprintf (line, "Ox" ITintmaxhexfmt, value);
00784   return line;
00785 }
00786 C_Integer C_string_to_oct (C_String str)
00787 {
00788   C_Integer value;
00789   sscanf (str, ITintmaxoctfmt, &value);
00790   return value;
00791 }
00792 C_String C_oct_to_string (C_Integer value, C_String line)
00793 {
00794   sprintf (line, "O" ITintmaxoctfmt, value);
00795   return line;
00796 }
00797 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00798 /*
00799  *      Assertion and error reporting.
00800  */
00801 void
00802 C_abort (void)
00803 {
00804   abort ();
00805 }
00806 void
00807 C_exit (int status)
00808 {
00809   exit (status);
00810 }
00811 void
00812 C_assert (int expression, char *error_mesg)
00813 {
00814   if (expression == 0)
00815     {
00816       fprintf (stderr, "# fatal error: %s\n", error_mesg);
00817       C_exit (1);
00818     }
00819 }
00820 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00821 #ifdef DEBUG_MALLOC
00822 static int malloc_size = 0;
00823 #endif
00824 
00825 /*
00826  *      Memory allocation.
00827  */
00828 C_Pointer C_calloc (int num_obj, int size_obj)
00829 {
00830   C_Pointer new_ptr;
00831   new_ptr = (C_Pointer) calloc (num_obj, size_obj);
00832   return new_ptr;
00833 }
00834 C_Pointer C_malloc (int size)
00835 {
00836   C_Pointer new_ptr;
00837   new_ptr = (C_Pointer) malloc (size);
00838 #ifdef DEBUG_MALLOC
00839   malloc_size += size;
00840   fprintf (stderr, "> malloc(%d) : %d\n", size, malloc_size);
00841 #endif
00842   return new_ptr;
00843 }
00844 C_Pointer C_calloc2 (int num_obj, int size_obj)
00845 {
00846   C_Pointer new_ptr;
00847   new_ptr = C_calloc (num_obj, size_obj);
00848   C_assert (new_ptr != 0, "out of memory space");
00849   return new_ptr;
00850 }
00851 C_Pointer C_malloc2 (int size)
00852 {
00853   C_Pointer new_ptr;
00854   new_ptr = C_malloc (size);
00855   C_assert (new_ptr != 0, "out of memory space");
00856   return new_ptr;
00857 }
00858 void
00859 C_free (C_Pointer ptr)
00860 {
00861   free (ptr);
00862 }
00863 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00864 /*
00865  *      File handling.
00866  */
00867 #define MAX_FILE                512
00868 #define MAX_NAME_LENGTH         512
00869 
00870 static struct
00871 {
00872   short defined;
00873   short eof;
00874   short mode;
00875   char *name;
00876   FILE *F;
00877 }
00878 files[MAX_FILE];
00879 
00880 #define INIT_FILE       {if (!init) init_file();}
00881 static int init = 0;
00882 static void
00883 init_file (void)
00884 {
00885   int i;
00886   for (i = 0; i < MAX_FILE; i++)
00887     {
00888       files[i].defined = 0;
00889     }
00890   files[C_STDIN].defined = 1;
00891   files[C_STDIN].mode = C_OPEN_READ_ONLY;
00892   files[C_STDIN].name = "stdin";
00893   files[C_STDIN].F = stdin;
00894   files[C_STDOUT].defined = 1;
00895   files[C_STDOUT].mode = C_OPEN_WRITE_ONLY;
00896   files[C_STDOUT].name = "stdout";
00897   files[C_STDOUT].F = stdout;
00898   files[C_STDERR].defined = 1;
00899   files[C_STDERR].mode = C_OPEN_WRITE_ONLY;
00900   files[C_STDERR].name = "stderr";
00901   files[C_STDERR].F = stderr;
00902   init = 1;
00903 }
00904 static int
00905 find_file (char *name)
00906 {
00907   int i;
00908   /*
00909    *  see if the entry has been defined.
00910    */
00911   for (i = 0; i < MAX_FILE; i++)
00912     if (files[i].defined && !C_strcmp (name, files[i].name))
00913       return i;
00914   return C_BAD_INDEX;
00915 }
00916 static int
00917 new_file (char *name)
00918 {
00919   int i;
00920   /*
00921    *  create a new entry.
00922    */
00923   for (i = 0; i < MAX_FILE; i++)
00924     if (files[i].defined == 0)
00925       break;
00926   C_assert (i != MAX_FILE, "too many files");
00927   files[i].defined = 1;
00928   files[i].eof = 0;
00929   files[i].mode = 0;
00930   files[i].name = C_strsave (name);
00931   files[i].F = 0;
00932   return i;
00933 }
00934 static void
00935 free_file (int i)
00936 {
00937   files[i].defined = 0;
00938   files[i].eof = 1;
00939   files[i].mode = 0;
00940   files[i].name = 0;
00941   files[i].F = 0;
00942 }
00943 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00944 extern int errno;
00945 /*
00946  *      Returns 0 if the file exists. Otherwise, returns 1.
00947  */
00948 
00949 /*
00950  *      OPEN / CLOSE REGULAR FILE
00951  */
00952 C_File C_open_file (C_String file_name, int mode)
00953 {
00954   int id;
00955   FILE *F = NULL;
00956   INIT_FILE;
00957   id = find_file (file_name);
00958   C_assert (id == C_BAD_INDEX,
00959             "C_open_file failed: cannot reopen an open file");
00960   switch (mode)
00961     {                           /* open file */
00962     case C_OPEN_READ_ONLY:
00963       F = fopen (file_name, "r");
00964       break;
00965     case C_OPEN_WRITE_ONLY:
00966       F = fopen (file_name, "w");
00967       break;
00968     case C_OPEN_APPEND_ONLY:
00969       F = fopen (file_name, "a");
00970       break;
00971     default:
00972       C_assert (0, "C_open_file: illegal mode");
00973     }
00974   if (F == 0)
00975     return C_BAD_INDEX;         /* cannot open file */
00976   id = new_file (file_name);
00977   files[id].eof = 0;
00978   files[id].mode = mode;
00979   files[id].F = F;
00980   return id;
00981 }
00982 int
00983 C_flush_file (C_File file)
00984 {
00985   INIT_FILE;
00986   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
00987     return C_FAILURE;           /* illegal file id */
00988   if (!files[file].defined)
00989     return C_FAILURE;           /* inactive file */
00990   if (files[file].mode == C_OPEN_READ_ONLY)
00991     return C_FAILURE;           /* cannot flush an input file */
00992   fflush (files[file].F);
00993   return C_SUCCESS;
00994 }
00995 int
00996 C_close_file (C_File file)
00997 {
00998   INIT_FILE;
00999   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01000     return C_FAILURE;           /* illegal file id */
01001   if (!files[file].defined)
01002     return C_FAILURE;           /* inactive file */
01003   fclose (files[file].F);
01004   free_file (file);
01005   return C_SUCCESS;
01006 }
01007 int
01008 C_create_tmp_file (C_String name)
01009 {
01010   INIT_FILE;
01011   C_strcpy (name, "___tmp.XXXXXX");
01012 #ifndef WIN32
01013   mkstemp (name);
01014 #else
01015   _mktemp (name);
01016 #endif
01017   return C_open_file (name, C_OPEN_WRITE_ONLY);
01018 }
01019 int
01020 C_remove_file (C_String name)
01021 {
01022 #ifndef WIN32
01023   if (unlink (name) == 0)
01024     return C_SUCCESS;
01025 #else
01026   if (_unlink (name) == 0)
01027     return C_SUCCESS;
01028 #endif
01029 
01030   return C_FAILURE;
01031 }
01032 int
01033 C_rename_file (C_String name, C_String new_name)
01034 {
01035   int status;
01036 #ifndef __WIN32__
01037   status = link (name, new_name);       /* must be on the same disk */
01038 #else
01039   /* ADA 5/29/96: Win96/NT has no link, use rename() */
01040   status = rename (name, new_name);     /* must be on the same disk */
01041 #endif
01042   if (status == C_BAD_INDEX)
01043     return C_FAILURE;
01044   if (unlink (name) == 0)
01045     return C_SUCCESS;
01046   return C_FAILURE;
01047 }
01048 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01049 /*
01050  *      CREATE / DESTROY DIRECTORY
01051  */
01052 int
01053 C_destroy_directory (C_String dir_name)
01054 {
01055 #ifndef WIN32
01056   if (rmdir (dir_name) == 0)
01057     return C_SUCCESS;
01058 #else
01059   if (_rmdir (dir_name) == 0)
01060     return C_SUCCESS;
01061 #endif
01062   return C_FAILURE;
01063 }
01064 /*
01065  *      Organized directory.
01066  */
01067 static C_String db_prefix = 0;
01068 static char db_index[MAX_NAME_LENGTH];
01069 
01070 static C_String
01071 index_file (C_String db_prefix)
01072 {
01073   sprintf (db_index, "%s/__INDEX__", db_prefix);
01074   return db_index;
01075 }
01076 static int
01077 add_record_index (C_String db_prefix, C_String name)
01078 {
01079   int fi;
01080   index_file (db_prefix);
01081   fi = C_open_file (db_index, C_OPEN_APPEND_ONLY);
01082   C_assert (fi != C_BAD_INDEX, "database: cannot open the index file");
01083   C_write_line (fi, name);
01084   C_close_file (fi);
01085   return C_SUCCESS;
01086 }
01087 static int
01088 delete_record_index (C_String db_prefix, C_String name)
01089 {
01090   int fi, ft;
01091   char tmpfile[MAX_NAME_LENGTH];
01092   char line[MAX_NAME_LENGTH];
01093   index_file (db_prefix);
01094   fi = C_open_file (db_index, C_OPEN_READ_ONLY);
01095   C_assert (fi != C_BAD_INDEX, "database: cannot open the index file");
01096   ft = C_create_tmp_file (tmpfile);
01097   C_assert (ft != C_BAD_INDEX, "database: cannot operate on the index  file");
01098   for (;;)
01099     {
01100       C_read_line (fi, line, MAX_NAME_LENGTH);
01101       if (C_eof (fi))
01102         break;
01103       if (!strcmp (line, name))
01104         continue;
01105       C_write_line (ft, line);
01106     }
01107   C_close_file (fi);
01108   C_close_file (ft);
01109   C_remove_file (db_index);
01110   C_rename_file (tmpfile, db_index);
01111   return C_SUCCESS;
01112 }
01113 static int
01114 destroy_all_records (C_String db_name)
01115 {
01116   char line[MAX_NAME_LENGTH];
01117   char name[MAX_NAME_LENGTH];
01118   int fi;
01119   index_file (db_name);
01120   fi = C_open_file (db_index, C_OPEN_READ_ONLY);
01121   if (fi == C_BAD_INDEX)
01122     return C_FAILURE;           /* corrupted database */
01123   for (;;)
01124     {
01125       C_read_line (fi, line, MAX_NAME_LENGTH);
01126       if (C_eof (fi))
01127         break;
01128       sprintf (name, "%s/%s", db_name, line);
01129       C_remove_file (name);
01130     }
01131   C_close_file (fi);
01132   C_remove_file (db_index);
01133   return C_SUCCESS;
01134 }
01135 /*
01136  *      DATABASE (organized directory)
01137  */
01138 int
01139 C_database_size (C_String db_name)
01140 {
01141   int size, fi;
01142   char line[MAX_NAME_LENGTH];
01143   index_file (db_name);
01144   fi = C_open_file (db_index, C_OPEN_READ_ONLY);
01145   if (fi == C_BAD_INDEX)
01146     return -1;
01147   size = 0;
01148   for (;;)
01149     {
01150       C_read_line (fi, line, MAX_NAME_LENGTH);
01151       if (C_eof (fi))
01152         break;
01153       size += 1;
01154     }
01155   C_close_file (fi);
01156   return size;
01157 }
01158 
01159 int
01160 C_destroy_database (C_String db_name)
01161 {
01162   destroy_all_records (db_name);
01163   return C_destroy_directory (db_name);
01164 }
01165 
01166 int
01167 C_disconnect_database (C_String db_name)
01168 {
01169   db_prefix = 0;
01170   return C_SUCCESS;             /* do nothing */
01171 }
01172 C_File C_read_record (C_String record_name)
01173 {
01174   char name[MAX_NAME_LENGTH];
01175   int i;
01176   C_assert (db_prefix != 0, "C_read_record: not connected to any database");
01177   sprintf (name, "%s/%s", db_prefix, record_name);
01178   i = C_open_file (name, C_OPEN_READ_ONLY);
01179   return i;
01180 }
01181 C_File C_write_record (C_String record_name)
01182 {
01183   char name[MAX_NAME_LENGTH];
01184   int i;
01185   C_assert (db_prefix != 0, "C_write_record: not connected to any database");
01186   sprintf (name, "%s/%s", db_prefix, record_name);
01187   i = C_open_file (name, C_OPEN_WRITE_ONLY);
01188   add_record_index (db_prefix, record_name);
01189   return i;
01190 }
01191 int
01192 C_destroy_record (C_String record_name)
01193 {
01194   char name[MAX_NAME_LENGTH];
01195   int i;
01196   C_assert (db_prefix != 0,
01197             "C_destroy_record: not connected to any database");
01198   sprintf (name, "%s/%s", db_prefix, record_name);
01199   i = C_remove_file (name);
01200   delete_record_index (db_prefix, record_name);
01201   return i;
01202 }
01203 /*
01204  *      READING / WRITING FILE
01205  */
01206 C_String C_file_name (C_File file)
01207 {
01208   INIT_FILE;
01209   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01210     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01211   if (!files[file].defined)
01212     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01213   return files[file].name;
01214 }
01215 int
01216 C_eof (C_File file)
01217 {
01218   INIT_FILE;
01219   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01220     return 1;                   /* illegal file id */
01221   if (!files[file].defined)
01222     return 1;                   /* inactive file */
01223   return files[file].eof;
01224 }
01225 int
01226 C_read_char (C_File file, C_Integer * value)
01227 {
01228   int ch;
01229   FILE *F;
01230   INIT_FILE;
01231   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01232     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01233   if (!files[file].defined)
01234     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01235   F = files[file].F;
01236   ch = getc (F);
01237   *value = ch;
01238   files[file].eof = (ch == EOF);
01239   return (ch != EOF);
01240 }
01241 int
01242 C_read_word (C_File file, C_String line, int length)
01243 {
01244   int ch, i;
01245   FILE *F;
01246   INIT_FILE;
01247   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01248     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01249   if (!files[file].defined)
01250     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01251   F = files[file].F;
01252   i = 0;
01253   while ((ch = getc (F)) != EOF)
01254     {                           /* skip over white space */
01255       if (!C_is_space (ch))
01256         {
01257           line[i] = ch;
01258           i += 1;
01259           break;
01260         }
01261     }
01262   while ((ch = getc (F)) != EOF)
01263     {                           /* read until white space */
01264       if (C_is_space (ch))
01265         break;
01266       line[i] = ch;
01267       i += 1;
01268       if (i >= (length - 1))
01269         break;
01270     }
01271   line[i] = '\0';
01272   files[file].eof = (ch == EOF);
01273   return (ch != EOF);
01274 }
01275 int
01276 C_read_integer (C_File file, C_Integer * value)
01277 {
01278   FILE *F;
01279   INIT_FILE;
01280   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01281     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01282   if (!files[file].defined)
01283     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01284   F = files[file].F;
01285   return fscanf (F, ITintmaxformat, value);
01286 }
01287 int
01288 C_read_float (C_File file, C_Float * value)
01289 {
01290   int i;
01291   float f;
01292   FILE *F;
01293   INIT_FILE;
01294   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01295     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01296   if (!files[file].defined)
01297     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01298   F = files[file].F;
01299   i = fscanf (F, "%e", &f);
01300   *value = f;
01301   return i;
01302 }
01303 int
01304 C_read_double (C_File file, C_Double * value)
01305 {
01306   int i;
01307   float f;
01308   FILE *F;
01309   INIT_FILE;
01310   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01311     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01312   if (!files[file].defined)
01313     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01314   F = files[file].F;
01315   i = fscanf (F, "%e", &f);
01316   *value = f;
01317   return i;
01318 }
01319 int
01320 C_read_line (C_File file, C_String line, int length)
01321 {
01322   int ch, i;
01323   FILE *F;
01324   INIT_FILE;
01325   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01326     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01327   if (!files[file].defined)
01328     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01329   F = files[file].F;
01330   i = 0;
01331   while ((ch = getc (F)) != EOF)
01332     {
01333       if (ch == C_NL)           /* exit loop upon EOLN */
01334         break;
01335       line[i] = ch;
01336       i += 1;
01337       if (i >= (length - 1))
01338         break;
01339     }
01340   line[i] = '\0';
01341   files[file].eof = (ch == EOF);
01342   return (ch != EOF);
01343 }
01344 int
01345 C_read_block (C_File file, C_String line, int length)
01346 {
01347   FILE *F;
01348   INIT_FILE;
01349   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01350     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01351   if (!files[file].defined)
01352     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01353   F = files[file].F;
01354   return (fread (line, sizeof (char), length, F));
01355 }
01356 int
01357 C_write_char (C_File file, C_Integer value)
01358 {
01359   FILE *F;
01360   INIT_FILE;
01361   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01362     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01363   if (!files[file].defined)
01364     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01365   F = files[file].F;
01366   return (putc (value, F));
01367 }
01368 int
01369 C_write_word (C_File file, C_String line)
01370 {
01371   FILE *F;
01372   INIT_FILE;
01373   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01374     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01375   if (!files[file].defined)
01376     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01377   F = files[file].F;
01378   return (fprintf (F, " %s", line));
01379 }
01380 int
01381 C_write_line (C_File file, C_String line)
01382 {
01383   FILE *F;
01384   INIT_FILE;
01385   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01386     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01387   if (!files[file].defined)
01388     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01389   F = files[file].F;
01390   return (fprintf (F, "%s\n", line));
01391 }
01392 int
01393 C_write_block (C_File file, C_String line, int length)
01394 {
01395   FILE *F;
01396   INIT_FILE;
01397   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01398     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01399   if (!files[file].defined)
01400     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01401   F = files[file].F;
01402   return (fwrite (line, sizeof (char), length, F));
01403 }
01404 int
01405 C_write_integer (C_File file, C_Integer value)
01406 {
01407   FILE *F;
01408   INIT_FILE;
01409   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01410     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01411   if (!files[file].defined)
01412     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01413   F = files[file].F;
01414   return (fprintf (F, " " ITintmaxformat, value));
01415 }
01416 int
01417 C_write_float (C_File file, C_Float value)
01418 {
01419   FILE *F;
01420   INIT_FILE;
01421   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01422     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01423   if (!files[file].defined)
01424     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01425   F = files[file].F;
01426   return (fprintf (F, " %.10f", value));
01427 }
01428 int
01429 C_write_double (C_File file, C_Double value)
01430 {
01431   FILE *F;
01432   INIT_FILE;
01433   if ((file < 0) || (file >= MAX_FILE))
01434     return 0;                   /* illegal file id */
01435   if (!files[file].defined)
01436     return 0;                   /* inactive file */
01437   F = files[file].F;
01438   return (fprintf (F, " %.10f", value));
01439 }
01440 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01441 /*
01442  *      Time functions.
01443  */
01444 long
01445 C_time (void)
01446 {
01447   return time (0);
01448 }
01449 char *
01450 C_asctime (time_t tm)
01451 {
01452   return ctime (&tm);
01453 }
01454 
01455 /* BCC - added for garbage collection - 8/22/96 */
01456 static void
01457 RemoveS (Str ptr)
01458 {
01459   if (ptr == 0)
01460     return;
01461   RemoveS (ptr->left);
01462   ptr->left = 0;
01463   RemoveS (ptr->right);
01464   ptr->right = 0;
01465   free (ptr->name);
01466   free (ptr);
01467 }
01468 
01469 /* BCC - added for garbage collection - 8/22/96 */
01470 void
01471 C_RemoveAllString ()
01472 {
01473   RemoveS (str_root);
01474   str_root = 0;
01475 }
